entry.title: SAP Fiori Development newsletter January 2026 (issue #38)
entry.content:
Happy New Year. If 2025 was the year of AI, what will 2026 bring? Likely more AI.

Some predictions:

  1. Vibe coding will become more mainstream with MCP servers and LLMs working together to deliver more predictable and consistent results.
  2. We will start to see the emergence of the ‚Äúpost-app‚Äù era in enterprise software. I don‚Äôt think it will be entirely chat-based, but I do expect some parts to be generated on demand.
  3. The knowledge gap between developers who use AI and those who don‚Äôt will continue to grow. Now, the early adopters have a 1-year head start. For those who choose to remain on the sidelines, that will continue to grow. Don‚Äôt be that person ‚Äì you need to start experimenting with AI, even if you don‚Äôt include the results in your production code

What are your predictions for 2026? Let us know or add to the comments below. If you want to discuss your thoughts with your fellow developers, I encourage you to join our monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable. Register online or email me for an invitation.

Development News

The complete 6-part SAP Fiori Development Portal blog series
In this 6-part series, Katrin Polloczek and Marcel Waechter explore the SAP Fiori development portal and how to use it. Topics include SAP Fiori elements, building blocks, extension options, custom pages, and how all these pieces fit together. Read part 1 ‚Äì with links to all the posts.

SAP Fiori tools 2601 update ‚Äì Mobile Device Preview, Building Blocks, and AI-Driven Productivity
SAP Fiori tools 2601 includes enhancements for previewing applications, managing system connections, building SAP Fiori elements‚Äìbased UIs, and accelerating development with AI-powered tooling. In parallel, we continue to refine the fundamentals in security, modeling, and extensibility. See details.

Joule in SAP Build Code can now create freestyle UI5 apps
Last year, we introduced the SAPUI5 extension for the Joule coding assistant in SAP Build Code Over time, it has evolved to support conversion of UI5 apps to TypeScript and setting up new pages and the respective navigation. The latest improvement lets you create new freestyle UI5 apps according to your requirements, bringing the functionality right to developers using SAP Build Code‚Äîno other tools needed. Discover how it works.

Inside Joule: Lessons from building an AI coding assistant for SAP Build
This is a "making of" article about the implementation of the new /ui5-create-app slash command available within Joule in SAP Build Code. This new feature enables a conversation between an application developer and their AI assistant about building a new freestyle UI5 application. Learn more.

UI5 MCP Server's New TypeScript Migration Feature
The new UI5 MCP server will give you a massive head start on converting your existing JavaScript UI5 apps to TypeScript. A multi-day manual conversion becomes an hour of agent work plus several hours of polishing. The time savings add up with each project. Learn more.

Harmonizing UI5 URLs: Convenient URLs for SAPUI5/OpenUI5 CDN
When accessing the UI5 Demo Kit and when using UI5 in cloud scenarios, you use URLs like https://ui5.sap.com/. We are harmonizing these URLs to make them future-proof. See more details.

Events

SAP Fiori Innovation Day 2025 is a wrap. The final event in Walldorf included an overview of AI capabilities in SAP Cloud ERP, two hands-on exercises, and some great insights from the sponsoring partners. Learn the details.

We are planning more SAP Fiori Innovation Days in 2026. Watch your inbox for announcements about where and when we will be hosting these events.

 

Call for papers is open for SAP Sapphire 2026Call for Proposals open for 2026 SAP Sapphire & ASUG Annual Conference Orlando.
Share your success story or lead an interactive discussion with your peers. 
Submit your proposal.

entry.title: Issue with Data Authorization in Public Dimension of SAP Analytics Cloud Model
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have implemented a model in SAP Analytics Cloud which includes a public organizational dimension with a hierarchy composed of four levels: division, business unit, sub business unit, and cost center. A story is built on top of this model.

We have defined data authorizations on this hierarchy, intending to control access as follows:

1. Users can see all data
2. Users can see data for one or more specific divisions
3. Users can see data for one or more business units within specific divisions
4. Users can see data for one or more sub business units within specific business units
5. Users can see data for one or more cost centers within specific sub business units

However, we are encountering an issue where authorization filtering does not work correctly starting from the business unit level and below. For example, users assigned read permissions at the business unit level do not see any data in reports, even though data exists and users with broader permissions see the data as expected. This behavior also occurs for the more granular authorization scenarios (sub business unit and cost center levels).

Has anyone experienced similar issues, or is this a known limitation or configuration consideration in SAC related to hierarchical authorization on public dimensions? Any guidance or suggested troubleshooting actions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for any support or insights you can provide.

entry.title: UTCTOLOCAL Function in Datasphere based on Plant TimeZone
entry.content:
We had the requirement from Business to convert the Date based on Plant's Mapped Local TimeZone. TimeZone is dynamic and picked up from TTZ5/TTZ5S table. Challenge was all the TimeZone mentioned in SAP table for plants wasn't working with UTCTOLOCAL function. 

This article provides instructions for installing and configuring timezone table in SAP Datasphere, including installing timezone tables (TTZD, TTZDF, TTZDV, TTZR, TTZZ) using Database Explorer and exporting them as per SNOTE 198411 and 1791342 with the export file HANATimezoneTables2023V02.tar.gz . It details modifying the SAP Datasphere Cloud ini configuration to set the default timezone schema and dataset, requiring SAP assistance due to Datasphere being hosted on public cloud, and checking timezone data in the sys.TIMEZONES view . The UTCTOLOCAL function is used to convert UTC to local timezones, and timezone mappings for specific plants can be retrieved from SAP standard tables TTZ5 or TTZ5S.

1. Using DataBase Explorer in Sap DataSphere install the TimeZone Table in Schema.
TTZD, TTZDF, TTZDV, TTZR, TTZZ

Refer the SNOTE 198411 and 1791342 for TimeZone Table export.

2. Check the Table in source once exported:

3.Change the parameter setting in ini configuration file. This would require SAP help as Datasphere is hosted on Public cloud.

a. Modify the default schema (mandatory in HANA Cloud, because SYSTEM schema cannot be used)

ALTER SYSTEM ALTER CONFIGURATION ('indexserver.ini', 'SYSTEM') SET ('global', 'timezone_default_data_schema_name') = 'SpaceNAME#SchemaName'  WITH RECONFIGURE;

b. Set 'sap' dataset to default (optional)

ALTER SYSTEM ALTER CONFIGURATION ('indexserver.ini', 'SYSTEM') SET ('global', 'timezone_dataset') = 'sap' WITH RECONFIGURE;

4. Check the data in sys.TimeZones View sap entries for TimeZone would have been populated. Plateform TimeZone entries by default available in the view. Post import of TimeZone Table sap TimeZone would reflect in TimeZones View.

Select * from sys. TIMEZONES;

5.Use the UTCTOLOCAL function to convert TimeZone to local Timezone.

We can get the TimeZone mapped to specific plants from Sap standard tables TTZ5 or TTZ5S

 

Hope This helps !!
Happy Learning  üôÇ

entry.title: How can the maximum number of concurrent sessions be increased?
entry.content: Currently, the maximum number of concurrent sessions for our Crystal Reports environment is 5. I think these sessions are shared between users logged into BI Launch Pad, CMC, and possibly also using the Crystal Reports software to create reports. It would be nice to increase the number of concurrent users to 10. When I look at the License Keys for our system, there are four options. SAP BI Dashboards (user), SAP Crystal Reports (user), SAP Crystal Server (user), and SAP Crystal Server(CS). The first three all have 12 and the last one has 1. However, we can only have 5 concurrent sessions, not 12. Can we increase that up to 12 somehow?

entry.title: News from SAP Activate SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602
entry.content:
We are pleased to announce the updates to SAP Activate, including the availability of eight roadmaps now offered in nine languages. We‚Äôre also excited to share the newly refreshed SAP Activate page on sap.com, which offers a clearer, more intuitive overview of the SAP Activate methodology. This release delivers a range of enhancements across SAP Activate assets, strengthening implementation guidance and improving usability. As always, our focus remains on simplifying and optimizing the implementation journey to provide a more seamless experience for our users. Below are the key highlights for this release:

  • Revamped SAP Activate page on SAP.com
  • Eight SAP Activate roadmaps Now Available in Nine Languages
  • SAP Activate Community Blogs and Activate Minute Videos
  • Updates to SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Updates to SAP Activate for SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • Updates to SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform
  • Updates to SAP Activate for Conversion of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2-system to 3-system landscape
  • Updates to SAP Activate for SAP SuccessFactors
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Test Automation Tool 2602 Release

 

Revamped SAP Activate page on SAP.com

We are excited to announce the launch of the revamped SAP Activate page on SAP.com! The updated experience delivers a clearer, more intuitive overview of the SAP Activate methodology, highlighting its phased approach, key benefits, real-world customer successes, and easy access to tools, road maps, and learning resources. Whether you‚Äôre just starting your cloud journey or deep into an implementation, the refreshed page makes it easier than ever to understand how SAP Activate helps accelerate transformation and drive faster time-to-value. Explore the new page here and see how SAP Activate continues to evolve to support your success.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Eight SAP Activate roadmaps Now Available in Nine Languages

SAP Activate roadmap content is now available in nine languages, making it easier for our users to consume guidance in the language they are most comfortable with. They can now access roadmap text in German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and English directly within SAP for ME. This is enabled through Machine Translation, which is now available across eight roadmaps:

  • SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Activate for SAP Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì New Implementation
  • SAP Activate for SAP Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì System Conversion
  • SAP Activate for SAP Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì Selective Data Transition
  • SAP Activate for SAP Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì Upgrade
  • SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform
  • SAP Activate for Conversion of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (2-system to 3-system)
  • SAP Activate for New Cloud Implementations (Public Cloud ‚Äì General)

For more details, refer to the blog.

 

SAP Activate Community | SAP Activate Blogs | SAP Activate Minute Videos

Join the SAP Activate Community to explore valuable content and resources while connecting with SAP partners, clients and internal colleagues by participating in discussions and sharing knowledge.

Make sure to follow the SAP Activate tag to access blog posts like those highlighted here, along with additional insights shared by SAP Activate experts within the community.

Recap of some blog posts from the community:

  • Introducing the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap by Ana Goetze
  • SAP Cloud ALM for Operations Content Now Available in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Road Map by Nicole Fuller
  • Deliver quality SAP BTP projects with SAP Activate and partner support services by Jose Bastidas
  • How the Transition to SAP Cloud ALM Roadmap Answers Your Top 5 Transition Questions by Ana Goetze
  • Who are you? Accountable or Responsible when standing for in the Fit-to-Standard process? by Jair Azevedo
  • RISE with SAP Methodology: A Practical Guide to Modernizing with Confidence by Manuel Lederle
  • Deep Dive: Inside the Framework of RISE with SAP Methodology by Manuel Lederle
  • SAP Activate for RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: Scenario-Specific Roadmaps by Kristen Reddington
  • Video: Best Practices to keep up to date on updates and changes in SAP Activate by Jan Musil

 

Updates of SAP Activate for SAP S/HANA Cloud Public Edition in 2602

The SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud implementation roadmap has been enhanced based on product management input, system functionality changes, and customer feedback. Below are highlights for this release.

  • Added guidance for system monitoring using SAP Cloud ALM which includes Business Process Monitoring, Integration & Exception Monitoring, User Monitoring, Job & Automation Monitoring, and Health Monitoring. Production Operations Monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM
  • Expanded the road maps to include a new run phase quality gate and consolidated the adoption plan checklists with the remaining phase gates. All quality gate questions are available as a form in SAP Cloud ALM with enhanced integration to delivery services. Conduct Project Quality Gate for Run Phase
  • Introduced Joule in road map viewer and Joule for Consultants based on Activate content making it more efficient for the customer to find information that they are looking for. 
  • Added a tag to identify the tasks required for the GROW Fast initiative where customers can go live with a fixed scope in 6 weeks.
  • Enhanced the Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to include detail related to downward compatibility. Importing configuration transports older than 1 release require SAP support. 3610869 - 3-System Landscape: Downward Compatibility Rule
  • Enable machine translations to provide the content via Road Map Viewer in 6 languages.
  • Included Business AI into the overall implementation methodology by providing easy access to the AI-powered scenarios at the time that they are needed.

 

Updates of SAP Activate for Cloud ERP Private

SAP Activate, the standardized framework for RISE with SAP Methodology, has been enhanced with numerous updates, which are listed in detail in the release notes. The most notable enhancements are the additions of WalkMe and the Transformation Preparation Service, as well as improvements to clean core governance, guidance, and measurement using the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard. Additionally, the roadmap viewer has been enhanced with Joule for information retrieval and language translations of SAP Activate content to eight languages, in addition to the content source in English.

Key highlights include:

  • Updated all accelerators to reflect the latest SAP S/4HANA 2025 release content, ensuring alignment with current release, guidance, and best practices across the SAP Activate methodology. 
  • Enhanced guidance for SAP Business Transformation Center by updating tasks, procedure steps, and accelerators to better support selective data transition execution.  
  • Enhanced UX Adoption and User Experience guidance, including updated UX workshops, value discovery accelerators, launchpad design guidance, and stronger linkage between UX strategy and Fit-to-Standard activities. We have updated several tasks to highlight the fact that FIORI/UX is the foundation for Clean Core and AI (like Joule). Additional details available via the User Experience tag.
  • Added a new Mix-and-Match (Selective Data Transition) guidance by updating and tagging key tasks across Prepare to Realize, adding a dedicated tag for Selective Data Transition in Mix-and-Match Scenario. 
  • Refresh of the Project Management workstream, updating purposes, procedures, and templates for governance, planning, sprint execution, phase closure, and multi-country delivery to improve lifecycle consistency. 
  • Expanded extensibility and analytics guidance, adding new accelerators and clearer procedures for key-user extensibility, classic extensibility, embedded analytics discovery, and initial analytics setup. 
  • Improved enablement and learning tasks, with new accelerators for learning needs analysis, enablement strategy, content development, WalkMe solution planning, and removal of redundant or outdated enablement steps. 
  • Refined system conversion and cutover execution clarity, including renamed tasks, updated conversion runbooks, improved readiness assessment guides, clearer cutover procedures, and better differentiation between sandbox, development, test, and production activities.

See the release notes for a complete list of all improvements. 

 

Updates of SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform

We‚Äôre excited to announce new content in the SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) that guides customers on how to design and develop solutions using SAP AI capabilities within SAP BTP. The roadmap now covers the following topics:

  • Incorporate AI and generative AI considerations while shaping the overall SAP BTP implementation approach and governance model
  • Identify where SAP AI services fit within the BTP account structure, environments, and development setup
  • Enable teams to explore AI capabilities alongside core BTP services during early self-learning and sandbox activities
  • Apply AI patterns during application design using ABAP Cloud, CAP, and SAP Build
  • Extend applications with Joule to deliver conversational and productivity-driven user interactions

 

Updates of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2-system landscape to 3-system landscape 

We are excited to share the latest improvements to the SAP Activate guidance for our customers converting their SAP S/4HANA Cloud from a 2-system landscape to a 3-system landscape. Since the last major release in August 2025, we have made several updates to the guidance based on the learnings from conversion projects and improvements to the conversion process. The key updates are outlined below:

  • Updated task Verify Authorizations in SAP for Me - updated procedure steps and accelerators.
  • Updated task Create and Schedule Test Plan and linked it to the task ‚ÄúCreate Test Strategy".
  • Updated task Identify Integrations Scenarios for setup on Test System in the procedure section to explain rebuilding integrations manually or using automation tools.
  • Updated task Create Solution Test Plans with new accelerator for SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal - Test Management.

In addition to the updates mentioned above, the Joule assistant in the road map viewer app has been enabled to support our users with 2SL to 3SL conversion-related questions. When you prompt Joule, remember to include ‚Äú2SL to 3SL conversion‚Äù in the prompt for higher quality results.

We recommend that all users preparing for the upcoming conversion project review the detailed release notes in the SAP Activate road map viewer for the latest content updates and view the conversion overview video on the Overview page of the conversion roadmap here.

 

Updates of SAP Activate for SAP SuccessFactors

The SAP Activate for SAP SuccessFactors roadmap has been enhanced based on product management input, system functionality changes, and customer feedback. Below are the highlights:

  • Introduced a quality gate checklist to the end of each phase. All quality gates are available as an interactive form in SAP Cloud ALM and enables enhanced integration to delivery services processes. Conduct Project Quality Gate for Prepare Phase
  • Simplified the task Add Super Admin Access to the SuccessFactors Instance based on process improvements. Linked directly to the help documentation for guidance.
  • Updated Determine Test Scope and other testing related tasks to utilize a process that is standard across multiple solutions.

Added references to SAP WalkMe to increase visibility on how SAP WalkMe can help during the implementation.

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Test Automation Tool 2602 Release

The CE2602 release introduces significant enhancements to Post Upgrade Testing (PUT), including advanced comparison capabilities, improved Test Data Container (TDC) AutoBind integration, and a new scoping capability in i-TS for Smart Execution. Together, these improvements enable smarter automation, more flexible test coverage, and a simplified test setup experience.

Key highlights include:

  • Full Scope Comparison (PUT)
    • Comprehensive Analysis: Compare two complete PUT executions (standard and custom) across different releases or test runs.
    • Side-by-Side Summary: Review execution summaries, triggers, and timestamps in a consolidated view.
    • Impact Identification: Quickly identify post-upgrade changes across the full PUT landscape to support validation and risk mitigation.
  • Comparison of Custom Automates (PUT)
    • Cross-Run Comparison: Compare custom automated PUT test plans executed across two different runs.
    • Instance-Level Status: View detailed execution statuses for each test plan, including Success, Failed, Pre-checks Failed, and Cancelled.
  • Enhanced AutoBind for Test Data Container Integration
    • Intelligent Mapping: Enhanced AutoBind logic automatically maps TDC fields to script labels for both standard and PUT automations.
    • Improved Accuracy: Ensures precise alignment between test data and test scripts.
    • Reduced Manual Effort: Minimizes manual configuration, accelerating test setup.
  • Scoping Capability in i-TS (Smart Execution)
    • Comprehensive Coverage: Combine i-TS recommended processes with standard and custom-defined processes when executing a custom PUT variant, reducing test scope gaps.
    • Flexible Execution: Selectively merge scopes to create a unified test run tailored to specific testing needs.
    • Improved Accuracy: Validates critical i-TS recommended scenarios alongside custom flows for a more reliable post-upgrade assessment.

Overall, these enhancements significantly improve testing efficiency, increase data accuracy, reduce manual effort, and boost productivity across post-upgrade test automation workflows.

Please share with us your feedback and questions in the comments to this blog post or directly via the feedback function in the SAP Activate road map viewer on SAP for Me.

Run simple ‚Äì SAP Activate ‚Äì Accelerate and simplify the adoption of SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Business Partner - VAT Registration Code check switch off (CMD_API007 or VMD_API043)
entry.content:
@Andi_M 

We have implemented the solution. However, because the general error message does not pop-up anymore, SAP triggers the s-called post processing office (PPO) mechanism. The update of the customer-specific data is delayed (occurs technically "on commit"), while all non-customer-specific business partner data are updated directly after pressing the save button. Due to the removal of the error in the custom functional module as proposed above, it is not possible any more during "COMMIT WORK" processing. Because of this errors that occur during processing of customer-specific data are saved in PPO and the corresponding customer-specific database tables are not updated. In the BP transaction, this leads to the following error message when saving: 

 

In MDS_PPO2 transaction you can see the following for business process CVI_03:

So the suggested solution in this blog solves one part, but as a result the PPO is triggered and the creation of the BP Person is still triggered.

 

Could you assist? 

 

Thank you!

entry.title: How to Setup Local Accounting Principle as Group Accounting Principle in S/4HANA Cloud (Ledger 4G)
entry.content:
Problem
With scope item 5W2 for Group Valuation, ledger 4G is deployed. On initial deployment the ledger is not enabled with an Accounting Principle assigned. This step must be complete before the system can be used, until the step is complete the system will trigger errors. 

Assignment of Accounting Principles can prove problematic, an acceptable combination that the system will allow can cause issues so this blog we want to give some guidance with more explanation on the recommendations from scenario 5 in KBA 3530183 - Assigning Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Details on Configuration in General Ledger Accounting and Asset Accounting 

Resolving
Ledger Level Accounting Principle Assignment

  • Leading Ledger 0L - Corp Accounting Principle IFRS
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/8a4fd7531a4d424de10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST "For these reasons, the leading ledger can act as the global ledger for the whole entity (that is, with the valuation done according to legal reporting requirements)."
  • Non Leading Ledger 2L ‚Äì Local Accounting Principle (blank at Ledger Level)
  • Non Leading Ledger 3L ‚Äì Corp Accounting Principle USGP
  • Non Leading Ledger 4G (Group Reporting) ‚Äì IFRS

In this scenario IFRS is used on Leading Ledger 0L, it is possible to exchange USGP for IFRS on the Leading Ledger, whichever Accounting Principle is assigned on Leading Ledger must be assigned on Ledger 4G.

Company Code Local Accounting Principle Assignment (Ledger 2L)

  • This gives flexibility to add additional company codes and additional Local Accounting Principles at a later time if needed.
  • Statistical Depreciation Areas are active only when Local Accounting Principle is assigned at Company Code Level.

With these settings scenario 5 will be complete as per KBA above, allowing posting, asset creation etc.

entry.title: üá©üá™ SAP CodeJam ABAP Cloud & ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model ‚Äì SPECIAL EDITION
entry.content:
In this SPECIAL EDITION of the ABAP Cloud & RAP CodeJam,  we want to address the experienced RAP developer that wants to learn first hand from our experts about the newest features that have been added to the RAP framework with the 2511 and the upcoming 2602 releases including:

  • Collaborative Draft
  • Draft Scope
  • Recommendations
  • Editable Treeview
  • Analytical Table (Read-Only)

The features will be presented upfront so that the participants can decide which feature(s) they want to implement by just using the Develop Applications section of our SAP Online Help.

As said this event is NOT suited for absolute beginners since we expect that the participants have a solid knowledge of ABAP Cloud and the development of RAP business objects.   Please do not register if you do not fit within this profile. 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Friday 20th February 2026 in St.Leon-Rot (near the SAP mothership in Walldorf) from 10:00 - 16:00 CET.   The language and content of the event will be in English.

 

Location:  SAP SE,   Building ROT03.   SAP-Allee 27   68789 St. Leon-Rot Germany

For more information about how to get to the event, please check 240319_20_sap_rot_how_to_find_us.pdf

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 35 attendees.

 If you wish to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. Two weeks before the event, we will ask you to confirm your attendance.

 

The instructors are Andre Fischer and several colleagues from the ABAP Platform Development Unit. We will provide an SAP BTP ABAP Environment system with the latest 2602 release.  Please be sure to have the LATEST ADT installed  https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-install-adt..html

 

We plan to collect feedback for the documentation and materials being used in the hands-on using issues in  Github.com, so please create a Github.com account in order to leverage that important feedback channel during the workshop.

Just trying to get SAP's attention to an issue with US payroll customers who have employees in Puerto Rico. Bijay

entry.title: In MTO, SO field in Planned/Purchase Req. is taking quotation/Inquiry no. of Reference Sales Order.
entry.content:
Hello Team,

In MTO scenarios, the generated Planned order/ Purchase Requisition number having the account assignment section where Sales Order field is available is taking the reference of Inquiry/Quotation number for the respective Sales Order. It also results in impacting the report of sales Order based output details.

As per business requirment, the client is expecting the output based on the Sales Order not on the basis of Inquiry/Quotation number for Assigned Sales Order. 

Please suggest how to map the scenario to get the desired result output, without impacting the other modules fundamental concepts like as Costing, Delivery and all.

Also, suggest the advantages and disadvantages of the other functionalities.

entry.title: SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud Service Order : Billing for complete Confirmation
entry.content:
Hi,

We have the following scenario:

A service order is created with multiple service items. Each day, several service confirmation items are created and marked as Completed (but not Final confirmation). At month-end, these completed confirmation items need to be invoiced.

Currently, the system only allows invoice generation when the service order status is set completed or service item status is completed or when a confirmation item is flagged as Final confirmation.

Is there any configuration or process that would allow billing of completed confirmation items regardless of whether the service item is completed or the confirmation item is marked as final?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: U.S Tax Reporter Year End 2025
entry.content:
@graziela - Urgent need - I can open notes if needed.  I have asked a few times about Box 14 items.  I link posted in the comment does not work.  But I have bigger issues I believe. 

For example - Colorado Employee Occupational Tax (/451) is required to be reported on the W2.  When we add it to box 14 - it shows up - however - we have employees in all states and all localities - example - Auburn AL - they have this same tax type AL0A - and it is being reported in Box 14 by default and is indicated as AL0A Occ tax - when we go to add this to box 14 to make it show up for CO - it is doubling for any other state that already is reported there by default. 

Same with OR PFML (/4B7) - it is not showing up in box 14 - for Oregon, but is showing up for ME and CO.  When we add the /4B7 to box 14 via custom configuration - it then doubles for ME and CO.  

NJ EFLI (/487) - is not required to be reported on the W2 - but the state says if you report it, it should be in box 14 - however this tax is showing up in Box 19 - and should not be for NJ.  Other states with this same tax type CT, MA, NY & WA - all report by default to box 14 without any custom configuration. 

 

We really need some guidance on this.

entry.title: Re: Test limit Tags & labels from Idea TDCP7---test edit posted idea - Status changed to: Investigating
How to execute/re-run the SDMI Class to migrate the newly added rows
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

Could you please let us know on how to execute/re-run for a single migration class?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to execute/re-run the SDMI Class to migrate the n...
entry.content:
Steps for systems which are before release  release S/4HANA 1909 (SAP_BASIS 7.54) 

  1. Open t-code SDM_MON
  2. Click on 'Current Client info' button
  3. Edit
  4. Restart finished Migration. 

Steps for systems which are after release  release S/4HANA 1909 (SAP_BASIS 7.54) 

  1. Open t-code SE24
  2. Choose Object Type 'CL_SDM_UTILS'
  3. Execute
  4. Choose Method 'RESET_MIGRATION_STATUS
  5. Click on execute
  6. Fill IV_CLIENT parameter with the affected client (for example 200)
  7. Fill IV_MIGRATION_CLASS with the affected migration class (for example: CL_NGC_CORE_SDM_DATUB_CABN)
  8. If multiple migration classes are affected, the process has to be done for all migration classes
  9. If multiple clients are affected, parameter IV_CLIENT can be left blank, and IV_INCL_CROSS_CLT_ACTION has to be flagged
  10. Execute

The following steps are the same for all releases 

  1. Open t-code SE38
  2. Choose report R_SDM_ONLINE_EXEC
  3. Click on execute
  4. Fill out the selection criteria (Name of migration class, Max. no. of parallel threads    =   4, All checkboxes must be unchecked! )
  5. Execute

entry.title: Re: Test limit Tags & labels from Idea TDCP7---test edit posted idea - Status changed to: Accepted
Intercompany posting having intra company entries. Can we create a Admin Company?
entry.content:
For one of our middle east Country operations, we have a total of 8 company codes ‚Äì Sao Company code A till company code H.
Now the company code A behaves as both an Admin company and an operating company.

So, for example when we do an allocation for a budget/expense, The funds are initially in Company code A and is the allocated to all other company code including self(via a separate profit center).

So when we post an intercompany accounting document , for example an allocation document, - the resultant document is a bit confusing as :
- Every IC Trading partner (TP D, C, D‚Ä¶.) is now having a transaction with 2 profit centers of the Company code A 

In the entry view of this document, the 1st line is debited from and then paid -
1st to another account in same company code
and then to 7 other trading partner (i.e. other company codes)

Entry View

   

Account

 

Profit center

Amount

CC-A

 

PC-Admin

100

CC-A

 

PC-Op

-40

CC-B

  

-25

CC-C

  

-35

 

But when you go to General Ledger view its 2 line each for every trading partner i.e. every trading partner is interacting with 2 PCs from company code 2070.

GL View

   

Account

 

Profit center

Amount

CC-A

entry.title: How to make standard Fiori apps open an extended Fiori app instead of the standard one?
entry.content:
Hello experts, good morning.

I would like to ask for your guidance regarding an issue we are facing while extending a standard Fiori application.

Context:
We were asked to extend a standard app in order to adjust a specific parameter within it. To achieve this, we used a SAPUI5 Adaptation Project from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

The required adjustments were successfully implemented, and the app was deployed correctly to our system. After that, the necessary Catalog, Group, and Role were created so the extended app could be used.

Initially, a custom (Z) Target Mapping was created for the extended app, based on the standard app‚Äôs target mapping, and everything was working as expected.

However, we later identified the following issue:

The standard app can be launched from other standard Fiori applications. When this navigation occurs, the standard app is always opened, but our requirement is for the extended app to be opened instead, so the requested change can be used.

To address this, we tried modifying the Target Mapping, keeping the same semantic object (or at least the same name), and removing the original target mapping, so that the apps performing the navigation would open the extended app.

This approach worked partially. For some users, the navigation opens the extended app correctly. However, when testing with other users who have more roles and profiles assigned, the system still opens the standard app instead of the extended one.

Additionally, we tried using the ‚ÄúAdd SAP Fiori Launchpad Config‚Äù option available in SAP BAS:

However, this option does not seem to work, may be deprecated, or not supported in our system, as we receive a ‚ÄúURL Not Found‚Äù error.

In summary, my main question is:

How can I make standard Fiori applications open the extended app instead of the standard one?

We have already tried adjusting the target mapping and exploring Launchpad configurations, but without complete success. At this point, we have run out of ideas and would really appreciate any guidance.

Do you know of any alternative approach, recommended solution, or documentation that could help in this scenario?

Thank you for your time and for reading my question.
I look forward to your comments.

Best regards,
EBZ

entry.title: Re: Which process log to the XI_SEC_MSG table?
entry.content:
Hello, 

This is generally related to the security configurations in the SOAP Adapter (also similar configuration options exist in other channel types). 
"SOAP messages can be secured either by using Web service security (signature only) or S/MIME standards (signature and encryption)." 
If the Security Profile option for either Web Services Security or S/MIME is enabled in the channel (see below screenshot), then these messages are written to the XI_SEC_MSG table. These entries must then be archived. 

Regards
Mark

entry.title: Re: How to use the OData Client Proxy in SAP S/4 HANA or How to use the OData Service Consumption Mo
entry.content:
I have finally managed to create a remote proxy using OData V4.

The key is the proxy factory class.

You will have to use this class /iwbep/cl_cp_client_proxy_fact instead of /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote.

@wagener-mark: Have you managed it? What is your problem with 

cl_http_client=>create_by_destination

You just have to use it like this and then call the proxy factory. Either for V2 or V4.

cl_http_client=>create_by_destination( 
    exporting  destination = 'RemoteConnection'
    importing  client      = client ).

Btw.: I've developed the proxy with S4HANA2023 FSP02.

entry.title: API-Based Bank Integration for SAP BCM ‚Äì Seeking Best Practices and Lessons Learned
entry.content:
We are planning to embark on a new project focused on integrating with banks via APIs. Currently, we use pain.001 messages to send payment instructions to the bank and transmit via SFTP and receive pain.002 responses, which we process to update BCM statuses.

For this new approach, we do not intend to use any SAP middleware components such as MBC or the Digital Payments Add-On. Instead, we aim to consume the bank‚Äôs existing APIs directly as there will be no APIs on our side. Also, we would like to continue using the BCM monitor but not sure how this will be updated using APIs. We are still using the S4HANA On-Premise version.

Questions for the Community

  • Has anyone implemented a similar API-based integration with banks?
  • How did you approach the implementation and testing with the bank?
  • Does the bank proactively notify you when they change or update their APIs?
  • How feasible is this scenario compared to traditional file-based integration or when using some middleware?

    Additional Considerations

    • Security: How do you manage authentication (OAuth, certificates, token refresh) and ensure secure data transmission?
    • Error Handling: What strategies do you use for retries, timeouts, and reconciliation if API calls fail or responses are delayed?
    • Monitoring: How do you track API performance and maintain an audit trail for compliance? Do you integrate with SAP BCM monitoring or build a custom dashboard?
    • Version Management: How do you handle API version changes and backward compatibility?
    • Performance: Are there latency issues compared to file-based pain.002 processing?

      Looking forward to your responses.

      Regards,

entry.title: New Expert-Guided Implementation: Joule Prerequisites and Activation
entry.content:
Establish the Foundation for Your AI Journey 

SAP Joule is transforming how organizations interact with SAP applications by bringing intelligence directly into everyday workflows. For customers to activate Joule and unlock its AI-powered capabilities, they must first prepare their SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS), SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), and integration foundations to fully realize the value of Joule from day one. 

To support customers with this essential preparation, we are pleased to introduce a new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI):  

Joule Prerequisites & Activation - a hands-on, expert-led program designed to help you configure all required technical components for a smooth Joule activation. 

This new offering helps customers understand Joule‚Äôs architecture, explore deployment options, configure platform prerequisites, and establish the identity and access foundation required for a secure activation. By the end of the EGI, participants will be positioned to complete all the prerequisites required to activate Joule, ensuring a seamless start to their AI adoption journey. 

Workshop Schedule 

To accommodate global participants, this session will be offered on the following dates and time zones as follows: 

2026 DatesTimeTime Zone 
January 19-2010:00AM - 12:00PMEMEA | CET
January 26-2711:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 
February 9-1010:00AM-12:00PMEMEA | CET
February 16-1711:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 
March 2-310:00AM-12:00PMEMEA | CET
March 9-1011:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 


Why This EGI Matters 

Before Joule can be activated, customers must ensure the right technical prerequisites are in place‚Äîacross SAP BTP, Cloud Identity Services, Build Work Zone, and Line-of-Business systems. This EGI provides: 

  • A clear, step-by-step path to completing these prerequisites 
  • Expert-led guidance for setting up SAP Cloud Identity Services including Identity Authentication Service (IAS)/Identity Provisioning Service (IPS), and entitlements 
  • Live configuration guidance in your SAP BTP environment and SAP Build Workzone (BWZ) 
  • Hands-on support through real examples and troubleshooting 

With AI rapidly becoming central to SAP‚Äôs product strategy, organizations need the right technical foundation to adopt Joule with confidence, security, and scalability. 

What You‚Äôll Learn: Program Overview 

This 2-day EGI blends instruction, demonstrations, and guided hands-on exercises. 

Day 1 ‚Äì Foundation & Architecture 

  • Understand Joule‚Äôs system architecture and deployment scenarios 
  • Learn how SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS/IPS), SAP BTP, SAP Build Work Zone, and LOB solutions work together 
  • Navigate BTP global accounts, subaccounts, entitlements, and subscriptions 
  • Validate system readiness and begin configuring your Joule environment 
  • Experience a live demonstration of Joule integrated with SAP SuccessFactors 

Day 2 ‚Äì Identity, Provisioning & Work Zone Integration 

  • Deep-dive into SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication (IAS) and Identity Provisioning (IPS) for Joule 
  • Integrate CIS with your corporate Identity Provider 
  • Configure SAP Build Workzone (BWZ) as the unified interface for Joule 
  • Establish trust relationships between systems 
  • Expose LOB content to BWZ and validate provisioning flows 


What You Will Achieve 

This new EGI equips your organization with everything needed to prepare for Joule activation, ensuring compliance, security, and a streamlined technical foundation from day one. 

If your organization is planning to adopt SAP Joule or preparing for AI-driven innovation within SAP applications, this EGI is the ideal starting point to fast-track your readiness and reduce implementation risk. 

By the end of the EGI, you will have: 

  • A configured SAP BTP environment with a designated Joule subaccount 
  • Completed IAS/IPS setup for secure authentication and provisioning 
  • Integrated BWZ as the experience layer for Joule 
  • Verified all activation prerequisites using a comprehensive readiness checklist 
  • Gained expert-backed confidence to run the Joule Booster and proceed with activation

How to Register 

Register here to secure your spot* today to learn from SAP experts and gain the skills to bring Business AI to life across your enterprise.

 * You may need to register your S-user for access to SAP Learning Hub to access the EGI registration page.  It is a one-time registration, click here.

Related Articles

Unlocking Joule and SAP Business AI from Strategy to Activation: Expert-Guided Implementation

entry.title: Re: Why SAP S/4HANA Go‚ÄëLives Fail After ‚ÄúSuccess‚Äù: The Hidden Content & Attachment Layer
entry.content:
Hi  

RobertVit

Absolutely agree ‚Äî external archiving is the target state and should be standard.

The problem I‚Äôm highlighting is that even with ArchiveLink or external content servers, migrations still move pointers and metadata, not the physical documents. If repositories, links, or KPro mappings are inconsistent, you end up with ‚Äúarchived‚Äù documents that no longer open, even though they‚Äôre not in HANA.

So the risk isn‚Äôt just where PDFs are stored, but whether the entire content chain (SOFFCONT1 / SRGBTBREL / KPro / ArchiveLink repositories) is validated end‚Äëto‚Äëend during conversion ‚Äî which most projects skip.

External archive is necessary ‚Äî but content validation is the missing gate.

entry.title: String type field length limitation issue when mapping HANA SQL script dataset to an ABAP itab.
entry.content:
Hello experts,

When I'm mapping HANA SQL script dataset to an ABAP itab, there is a length limitation with string type fields.

string_agg(t5.json_data, ' ' order by canum) as json_data "AS NVARCHAR
to_clob(string_agg( t5.json_data,'' order by canum )      "AS CLOB

This function works correctly in the DBeaver query window, successfully returning a string with an actual field value length that exceeds 27,000 characters.

However, this function does not perform as expected when mapping a HANA dataset to an ABAP internal table.

It faces limitations, such as nvarchar being restricted to 5,000 characters and clob to 16,384 characters, resulting in the truncation of the actual field value.

The code is as follows:

types: begin of ty_data_in,
           count           type i,
           enq_lck_arg     type char50,
           tstp            type timestamp,
           itfid           type ze_itfid,
           id              type zfunc_log_id,
           func_name       type zfunc_log_data-func_name,
           func_parameter  type zfunc_log_data-func_parameter,
           func_paramtype  type zfunc_log_data-func_paramtype,
           func_structure  type zfunc_log_data-func_structure,
           func_defaultval type zfunc_log_data-func_defaultval,
           func_type       type zfunc_log_data-func_type,
           func_class      type zfunc_log_data-func_class,
           func_ref_class  type zfunc_log_data-func_ref_class,
           json_data       type string,
           proc            type flag,
         end of ty_data_in. 
  data: lt_data_in     type table of ty_data_in with empty key,
        lt_stmt        type table of string,
        l_stmt         type string.

lt_stmt[] = value #( ( |with | )
				   ( |t2 as (| )
				   ( |select t1.note3 as enq_lck_arg,t1.tzntstmps_beg as tstp,t1.note1 as itfid,t1.id| )
				   ( |  from zfunc_log as t1| )
				   ( |  where t1.note1 { l_zrfcid }| )
				   ( |    and t1.erdat { l_erdat }| )
				   ( |    and t1.code in ('I')| )
				   ( |),| )
				   ( |t3 as (select t2.enq_lck_arg,sum( 1 ) as count from t2 group by t2.enq_lck_arg order by t2.enq_lck_arg),| )
				   ( |t4 as (| )
				   ( |select t2.enq_lck_arg,t2.tstp,t2.itfid,t2.id,t3.count| )
				   ( |  from t2| )
				   ( |  join t3 on t3.enq_lck_arg = t2.enq_lck_arg| )
				   ( |  order by t3.count,t2.enq_lck_arg,t2.tstp,t2.itfid,t2.id| )
				   ( |)| )
				   ( |select t4.count,t4.enq_lck_arg,t4.tstp,t4.itfid,t4.id,| )
				   ( |       t5.func_name,t5.func_parameter,t5.func_paramtype,t5.func_structure,t5.func_defaultval,t5.func_type,t5.func_class,t5.func_ref_class,string_agg( t5.json_data,' ' order by canum ) as json_data| )
				   ( |  from t4| )
				   ( |  join zfunc_log_data as t5 on t5.id = t4.id| )
				   ( |  group by t4.count,t4.enq_lck_arg,t4.tstp,t4.itfid,t4.id,t5.func_name,t5.func_parameter,t5.func_paramtype,t5.func_structure,t5.func_defaultval,t5.func_type,t5.func_class,t5.func_ref_class| )
				   ( |  order by t4.count,t4.enq_lck_arg,t4.tstp,t4.itfid,t4.id,t5.func_name,t5.func_parameter,t5.func_paramtype,t5.func_structure,t5.func_defaultval,t5.func_type,t5.func_class,t5.func_ref_class;| )
				   ).
l_stmt = reduce #( init sum type string for wa in lt_stmt[] next sum = cond #( when sum is initial then wa else |{ sum }{ wa }| ) ). 

perform frm_hana_exec_query tables lt_data_in[] using l_stmt."json_data string type  still got length limit

form frm_hana_exec_query tables pt_data type table
                         using  p_stmt type string.
  data: l_s_dbindex type dbindex,
        l_stmt      type string,
        lref_data   type ref to data,
        lref_stmt   type ref to cl_sql_statement,
        lref_rslt   type ref to cl_sql_result_set.
  field-symbols: <fs_data> type any.

  try.
      assign pt_data[] to <fs_data>.
      l_stmt = p_stmt.

      create object lref_stmt.
      "lref_stmt->set_param( ref #( tabname ) ).
      "lref_stmt->set_param( ref #( l_schema ) ).

      lref_rslt = lref_stmt->execute_query( l_stmt ).
      get reference of <fs_data> into lref_data.
      lref_rslt->set_param_table( lref_data ).
      lref_rslt->next_package( ).
      lref_rslt->close( ).
    catch cx_sql_exception into data(lref_sqlerr).
      free: <fs_data>.
      data(l_msg) = lref_sqlerr->get_longtext( ).
      message |HANA QUERY ERROR: { l_msg }| type 'E'.
  endtry.
endform.

entry.title: Is freight order confirmation Mandatory for Freight Tracking purpose on Carrier API integration?
entry.content:
Hi, I have a quick question about carrier integration below.I'm grateful very much if you can advise. Thanks in advance.

  • Carrier integration method: API, Shipper will also send FO to BNL,but shipper only require order events, and Shipper will also send tracking request to carrier.
  • Integration scope : Freight Tracking Only. (Carrier doesn't integrate FO to their own carrier system)

My understanding is that, in technical view, because carrier can POST order event to BNL based on tracking Request they have created using Provider API for order event, Order confirmation is not prerequisites for API integration scenarios.  Am I correct? (Seems for manual process, order confirmation is required before send order event to shipper)

entry.title: Extending SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Build: Building a Global Payroll Dashboard Using ECP Data
entry.content:
Before we dive in, it‚Äôs important to clarify the scope.

This blog does not cover:

  • How to build or expose ECP APIs
  • How to configure SAP BTP destinations
  • How to technically connect SuccessFactors with SAP BTP
  • How SAP BTP integrates with Employee Central or ECP

All backend integrations are assumed to be already in place.

üéØThe focus here is purely on how SAP SuccessFactors functionality can be extended using SAP Build and side-by-side extensibility.

The End Goal: A Global Payroll Dashboard Inside the People Profile

 

The screen above represents the final outcome of this journey:
A Global Payroll Dashboard embedded directly into the Latest People Profile, showing payroll headcount insights sourced from ECP.

This dashboard is:

  • Built using SAP Build
  • Deployed on SAP BTP
  • Embedded into SuccessFactors as a side-by-side extension card

No core SuccessFactors customization. No upgrade risk.

Why Side-by-Side Extensibility?

Traditional customizations can slow innovation and complicate upgrades. Side-by-side extensibility offers a smarter approach. 

With side-by-side extensibility:

  • Custom logic runs outside the SuccessFactors core
  • Extensions are built and managed on SAP BTP
  • The core HR system remains clean and upgrade-safe

SAP Build makes this approach accessible by enabling both low-code and pro-code development models‚Äîallowing HR IT teams to move faster without sacrificing governance.

Step 1: Starting in SAP SuccessFactors

The journey begins in SuccessFactors, where administrators:

  • Navigate using global search
  • Access the Latest People Profile configuration
  • Manage profile layout, categories, and extension cards

This ensures that extensions feel native to the SuccessFactors experience.

Step 2: Creating a Side-by-Side Extension with SAP Build

Using the extensibility capabilities in SuccessFactors:

  • A new side-by-side extension is created
  • SAP Build is selected as the development approach
  • An SAP Fiori Card‚Äìbased UI is chosen

This step defines how the extension will later appear inside the People Profile.

Step 3: Designing the Payroll Card in SAP Build

Once the extension is created, development continues in SAP Business Application Studio:

  • Payroll data is consumed from ECP (via preconfigured integrations)
  • Card logic and visualization are defined
  • Live previews help validate the user experience

This is where raw payroll data becomes meaningful insight.

Step 4: Deploying Back to SuccessFactors

 

After development:

  • The SAP Build card is deployed
  • A secure SAP BTP destination is selected
  • The extension becomes available to SuccessFactors

This seamless handoff highlights the power of SAP BTP as an extensibility platform.

Step 5: Embedding the Card in the Latest People Profile

 

 

 

Back in SuccessFactors:

  • A custom Global Payroll Dashboard category is created
  • The SAP Build card is assigned to the category
  • Visibility and order are controlled

The result is a role-based, personalized profile experience.

The Final Experience: Payroll Insights Where Users Work

For end users‚ÄîHR, payroll admins, or managers‚Äîthe experience is simple:

  • Navigate to My Employee File
  • Open the Global Payroll Dashboard
  • View payroll insights directly in context

No additional apps. No context switching.

Key Takeaways

Side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build enables organizations to:

  • Extend SAP SuccessFactors without modifying the core system
  • Transform real ECP payroll data into actionable insights
  • Deliver custom dashboards directly inside the People Profile
  • Innovate faster while remaining upgrade-safe

SAP Build + SAP BTP + SuccessFactors = Clean-core innovation done right.

Final Thoughts

This journey demonstrates that extensibility doesn‚Äôt have to be complex or risky. With SAP Build and side-by-side extensibility, SuccessFactors becomes a platform for continuous innovation‚Äîwhile keeping the core stable and future-ready.

If you‚Äôre exploring ways to bring payroll, finance, or external insights into SuccessFactors, this approach is a powerful pattern worth adopting.

I‚Äôve also created a YouTube video demonstrating this end-to-end scenario using SAP Build and side-by-side extensibility: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4lz0w2v-kE

entry.title: Q4 2025 Innovations: SAP Enterprise Service Management
entry.content:
Welcome to the quarterly innovation highlights for  SAP Enterprise Service Management for Q4 2025.  Here, I want to feature some key capabilities that have been released within the past three months. We invite you to register for our Q4 2025 Innovations webcast for SAP Enterprise Management and Service Cloud on Tuesday, January 27th and SAP Sales Cloud and Foundation on Wednesday, January 28th ensuring you stay up-to-date on all the innovations and improvements delivered in Q4 2025.

Also, Learn more about the latest Q4 2025 innovations across the SAP CX portfolio here.

What‚Äôs New in SAP Enterprise Service Management
 SAP Enterprise Management is unifying internal service delivery operations across the globe. AI is driving measurable results in workplace productivity and stay tuned for an update on the progress of our ESM@SAP initiative ‚Äì with already more than 1200 support agents across more than 10 use cases from learning to finance and people and culture using SAP ESM!  Tight integration with the SAP Cloud ERP applications is driving quick deployments, quick time-to-value and bringing users high satisfaction by delivering a truly unified workspace.

Before we jump into the highlights,  please remember to review Kirsi‚Äôs Q4 2025 release blog for SAP Service Cloud blog which provides additional innovation highlights benefiting SAP Enterprise Service Management as well!

Now, let me introduce you to some Q4 2025 innovations spanning across useability, extensibility, automation and more!

Personalized KPI Cards in Home Page & Cases:

Personalized KPI cards enables business level configuration of real time app data presented in the home page or in cases to ensure support agents and managers have a pulse on performance. Bringing together information from various applications helps to ensure KPI‚Äôs are meaningful and deliver the right insights.

Object-Based Navigation in Mashups

Mashups enable a unified workspace and align various parameters into the business context. However, it is common, especially with custom applications for support agents to work in a separate browser tab.  This navigation enables a quick view to open from custom timeline events in a new browser tab while maintain key parameters.

Navigate to Custom UI‚Äôs from Mashups

Ease of navigation is key for support agents. Ensuring processes can be modeled effectively is critical to not only ensure agent satisfaction but to facilitate quick resolutions. Navigation from mashups is now expanded to custom UI‚Äôs.

Shortcuts in the Shell Bar

Recent items and favorites have been added to the shortcuts in the shell bar.  Service agents can now access a quick list of their favorites with a click in the shell bar reducing navigation steps. Additionally, an agent can easily retrieve complex tasks or activities they have in-work with one click to view the last 15 recent items. They can bypass menus and searches for one-click access to active work items.

Reference field usage in the Case

The ability to use fields from other entities such as employee, supplier or customer in the case is supports context and processing. Enabling these entities as reference fields in the case processes such as autoflow or rules and in defining customer logic helps streamline processes for the support agent and enables deep context ensuring the right data is considered and included in case resolution steps.

Intent-Based Navigation

Embedded analytics drive key insights to user, now with intent-based navigation a user can go from our embedded SAP Analytics Cloud directly to a case or other entity and make updates without having to click through menu navigation. This truly is ‚Äúfrom insights to action,‚Äù in just a click or two. Check out more details and a video on Intent-Based Navigation in my colleague Shameek‚Äôs blog.  

Case Step Pre-Conditions including Business Documents

Business document integration with SAP Enterprise Service Management creates clean and streamlined experiences for support issues on invoices, disputes and other documents. With the ability to define case step pre-conditions based on values in these business documents case processes and flows can be automated to reflect business document updates.  As an example, if an invoice status changes to 'posted' then a related case can be set to 'closed' automatically without further support.

WalkMe In-App Help

WalkMe is an AI-powered digital adoption platform integrated across SAP Cloud ERP applications and is now integrated with SAP Enterprise Service Management. WalkMe not only accelerates onboarding and new agent training, it enables intuitive, in-app guidance for support agents on-demand. With WalkMe, teams can create step-by-step walkthroughs and contextual tips directly within the application. Additionally, WalkMe provides visibility into where agents encounter friction‚Äîhelping organizations continuously optimize their service processes.

Form Attachments

An enhancement to the existing dynamic forms capability enables form-based inquiry to include processes-specific documents. Employees or other users can upload relevant documents during request submission reducing follow-ups or additional cycles to gather missing information. As per the case type, the intake form can be defined to designate specific attachments as required reducing errors and reducing risk, especially valuable with  case flows for audits and compliance regulations.

Additional

Use the SAP Enterprise Service Management managed tag when posting on SAP ESM topics! And thank you for your active participation in the community. We all benefit from hearing about successes and challenges with SAP Enterprise Service Management and how you‚Äôre using the solution. 

If you feel you have missed some innovations ‚Äì check the What‚Äôs New ‚Äì and filter by a date range to see all the innovations and improvements  delivered. Never miss an innovation!

entry.title: Re: SAP Business One Service Layer ‚Äì Copy From Landed Cos...
entry.content: Thanks for confirming. This is an important Service Layer limitation to be aware of ‚Äî Landed Cost ‚Üí A/P Invoice linkage is only supported via GUI, not DI API or Service Layer. For automation, teams typically accept no relationship map or use a hybrid GUI/RPA approach for this step.

entry.title: Re: Why SAP B1 Landed Cost Distribution Rule not copy ove...
entry.content:
This is standard SAP B1 behavior.

  1. Yes ‚Äî when you copy Landed Cost to A/P Invoice, the document becomes Service type by design.

  2. Distribution Rules are not carried over from Landed Cost to the broker A/P Invoice. SAP does not map cost center/distribution rules in this copy process.

  3. Same behavior applies even with a single line ‚Äî it‚Äôs a system limitation, not a configuration issue.

Distribution Rules must be manually maintained on the A/P Invoice or handled via customization/add-on if required.

entry.title: Re: Issue in Printing 7 Copies of Invoice ‚Äì Item Table No...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this is a known limitation of Adobe Forms + Output Management.

Root cause:

  • Tables (item loops) cannot be placed inside a repeating subform that itself repeats the whole invoice.

  • This is why the item table renders only once and Adobe throws errors when nested in the repeat layout.

Correct approach:

  • Create one main repeating subform (7 occurrences).

  • Inside it, place: Header + Item table + Totals.

  • Set the item table to flow and repeat per data, not per layout.

  • Do not nest repeating tables inside another repeating container.

Copy labels:

  • Use the occurrence index ($.index / instanceIndex) of the repeating subform.

  • Drive labels via conditional text, e.g.:

    • 1 = Original

    • 2 = Duplicate

    • 3 = Triplicate

    • 4‚Äì7 = Extra Copy

This is the only supported pattern in Public Cloud since print parameters (number of copies) are not available.

entry.title: Re: eDoc Cockpit - Connection to partner timed o ut after...
entry.content:
This is a known limitation in eDocument Cockpit / DRC when handling large attachments.

The 600s timeout comes from the ICF / ICM / SOAP runtime, not from the eDocument framework itself. Increasing icm/server_port_* timeout may help technically, but it is not the recommended solution.

Recommended approaches:

Avoid sending very large attachments (30MB is high for synchronous SOAP).

Store the document in ArchiveLink / external repository and send a reference or hash instead of the full binary.

If supported by the partner, switch to asynchronous processing rather than synchronous SOAP.

Extending timeouts only masks the issue and may impact system stability

entry.title: Re: SAP BP best practice: payer vs bill to when member VA...
entry.content: Excellent explanation and fully aligned with SAP best practice. Keeping the VAT‚Äëliable member as Payer and using Alternative Payee for settlement cleanly separates tax, legal invoicing, and cash flow without compromising compliance.

entry.title: Re: Why Vectorized Master Data is Critical for AI on SAP ECC and S/4HANA
entry.content: Strong point on vectorization. AI agents fail not because of models, but because SAP data isn‚Äôt prepared for semantic access. RAG + delta‚Äëbased vectorization is the missing layer between SAP and reliable AI.

entry.title: Re: S4HANA Public Cloud (INDIA) - ODN for Supplier Reduct...
entry.content: In S/4HANA Public Cloud (India), ODN is currently supported only for SD (sales) documents. ODN generation for MM supplier invoices / debit notes (RE/RK) is not supported yet due to statutory scope limitations.

entry.title: Re: SAP Success Factors Manage Document
entry.content: Nice overview of SuccessFactors Manage Documents. Very helpful summary of features, RBP, and storage considerations.

entry.title: Re: AMEX Expense Itemizations
entry.content: Following this ‚Äî facing a similar challenge with AMEX consolidated invoices in Concur.

entry.title: Re: FREIGHT COST (Planned Delivery costs)
entry.content: In standard S/4HANA Public Cloud, planned delivery costs are PO‚Äëheader based and allow only one freight vendor. For multiple freight vendors per partial delivery, SAP‚Äërecommended approaches are unplanned delivery costs at MIRO or separate service POs per shipment. Changing freight vendor per GR is not supported without customization.

entry.title: Re: Overhead Cost Calculation on WBS ‚Äì No Results Generated
entry.content: If the same cost elements are already in the costing sheet base, please also check: ‚Ä¢ WBS has Overhead Key assigned (Project/WBS master) ‚Ä¢ Cost elements are primary (category 1) and non‚Äëstatistical ‚Ä¢ Costs are posted directly to the WBS (not via cost center settlement) ‚Ä¢ Costing sheet validity dates, controlling area, and version match the run In Public Cloud, missing Overhead Key on WBS is the most common reason for ‚Äúsuccessful run with zero results‚Äù.

entry.title: Re: Auto-download Documents
entry.content:
This is not possible via configuration in SAP Service and Asset Manager.
Attachments are downloaded on‚Äëdemand only to avoid performance and storage issues.
Showing ‚ÄúOpen‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúDownload‚Äù requires a custom extension (MDK/client‚Äëside customization).

entry.title: Re: Question: Delivery-cost condition error during Servic...
entry.content: This is by design. Delivery cost condition types are meant for material logistics (GR/freight) and are not relevant for service POs / SES. If the same pricing schema is used for both materials and services, SAP will still validate the condition during SES and may raise errors. Best practice is to use a separate calculation schema for service POs or exclude delivery‚Äëcost condition types from service scenarios.

entry.title: Re: Harmonised System codes from catalogue item in Guided Buying
entry.content: In standalone SAP Ariba Buying, HS codes from supplier catalogs are not supported as a standard visible/reportable field at requisition line level. The requisition shows the commodity code (UNSPSC / ERP mapping) only. HS codes can exist in the catalog but are not exposed by default.

entry.title: Re: Can you remember the first time you heard of SAP
entry.content: I first heard of SAP working in Microsoft Business Solutions 20 years ago.

entry.title: Re: Storing of documents in database table
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition there is no official support for storing attachments temporarily in custom tables (RAWSTRING/BLOB), even as an interim step.

The recommended pattern is to create a draft or preliminary business object early (for example using RAP draft handling or a lightweight ‚Äúrequest‚Äù BO) and attach documents to it using the standard Attachment APIs. Upon approval, this BO is either finalized or transformed into the final contract object.

References you can look into:
‚Ä¢ RAP Draft Handling concept (Draft BOs before final save)
‚Ä¢ Attachment Service for Business Objects (API_ATTACHMENT_SRV)
‚Ä¢ Extensibility guidelines: ‚ÄúDo not store large binaries in custom tables in Public Cloud‚Äù

This avoids database growth, audit issues, and upgrade risks.
